H0.text: Electricity is what hydrogen-based fuel cells were and are used to provide for manned space vehicles.

H1.text: Light is provided by hydrogenâ€‘based fuel cells for manned space vehicles.

H2.text: Magnetism is what hydrogen-based fuel cells were and are used to provide for manned space vehicles.

H3.text: Gravity is what hydrogen-based fuel cells were and are used to provide for manned space vehicles.

A4.text: The alkaline fuel cell, also known as the Bacon fuel cell after its inventor, has been used in NASA space programs since the mid-1960s to generate power for satellites and space capsules.

A5.text: The alkaline fuel cell (AFC) or hydrogen-oxygen fuel cell was designed and first demonstrated publicly by Francis Thomas Bacon in 1959. It was used as a primary source of electrical energy in the Apollo space program.
